headline: Jamie Dimon Poaches Buffett Insider Todd Combs, and Wall Street Is Reading Between the Lines
summary: Jamie Dimon, the CEO of JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE:JPM), has brought Todd Combs on board. What Happened: Combs, previously an investment manager for Warren Buffett at Berkshire Hathaway Inc. (NYSE:BRK), is set to head a new $10 billion group at JPMorgan. Combs, once seen as a potential successor to Buffett, will also serve as a special advisor to Dimon. This strategic hire is viewed as Dimon’s effort to infuse Buffett’s investment acumen into JPMorgan. Combs’ successful stint as a JPMorgan board

headline: Morgan Stanley Maintains An Equal Weight Rating On JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM)
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE:JPM) is among the 12 Best Performing Dow Stocks in 2025. According to The Fly on December 10, 2025, Morgan Stanley reduced JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE:JPM) price objective from $338 to $331. The firm kept an Equal Weight rating on JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE:JPM). The firm revised its EPS […]

headline: End of 'The Berkshire Way'? Combs' departure isn't only big change as Buffett transition nears
summary: There were several additional personnel changes in Monday's three-page news release that signal the company is moving toward a more conventional structure.

headline: JIVE: This Hidden Gem ETF Is A Superb Blend Of Diversification, Growth, And Alpha
summary: JPMorgan International Value ETF returned 36% last year, targets undervalued foreign large-caps, holds 36% financials, and yields 1.72%. Learn why JIVE ETF is a buy.
